Introduction
Throughout history and in modern times, large corporations have played a significant role in shaping societies, economies, and politics. These corporate entities have transformed cultural and social structures, exerted control over capital and labor, influenced consumer behavior, and been actively involved in political lobbying and legislation. This essay aims to explore the profound
